business.headline: Luxury vs affordable housing: What homebuyers prefer during festive seasonThe festive months are traditionally seen as an auspicious time to buy homes. But as real estate sentiment rises across cities, one question stands out — are buyers chasing luxury spaces or choosing affordability amid rising costs?

LIC refutes Washington Post report on $3.9-billion Adani investment planA Washington Post report claimed that the Finance Ministry expedited a proposal directing nearly $3.9 billion (Rs 33,000 crore) in investments from the Life Insurance Corporation of India (LIC) into the Adani Group. The life insurance major rejected the claims as baseless.
Writing a will? These common mistakes can land it in courtFrom Bollywood families to neighbourhood households, inheritance battles have shown that even the most watertight wills can spring leaks.

Reliance says it will comply with new US, Western sanctions on Russian oilThe oil-to-retail behemoth said that it is assessing the implications of restrictions announced by the European Union, the United Kingdom and the United States on crude oil imports from Russia and the export of refined products to Europe.

No trade deals with a gun to our head: Piyush Goyal on India-US trade talksThis special report covers Union Commerce Minister Piyush Goyal's firm message on India's approach to international trade negotiations, particularly regarding the United States. Speaking at the Berlin Global Dialogue, Mr. Goyal made it clear that India will not be rushed into agreements. He stated, 'we do not do deals in a hurry, and we do not go ahead and sign any deals with deadlines or with a gun to our head'. The minister emphasized that for India, trade deals are not merely about tariffs or market access but are long-term partnerships built on trust and mutual respect between nations. This stance comes amid ongoing trade discussions with both the US and the European Union, where India is advocating for fair and equitable agreements that benefit its businesses and economy in the long run.

Don't do deals with gun to our head: Piyush Goyal on trade talks with USIndia is exploring newer markets to reduce the impact of high tariffs and ensure fair trade terms for its exporters, said Piyush Goyal. He noted that India's approach is guided by strategy and self-interest rather than external pressure.
Sensex closes 320 points lower, Nifty below 25,800; HUL down 3%The S&P BSE Sensex lost 344.52 points to close at 84,211.88, while the NSE Nifty50 lost 96.25 points to end at 25,795.15.

Have you been investing in mutual funds the wrong way all this time?Experts say that most investors rely only on absolute returns while judging a mutual fund's performance. They focus on the number showing how much profit they've made, without understanding the factors behind those returns.

US maize import talks rattle Indian farmers as prices fall below MSPReports suggest that if the trade deal goes through and American maize starts entering Indian markets — prices could crash, and farmers may face huge losses.

Sensex tumbles 600 points: Why the stock market is falling todayThe fall came as investors engaged in profit booking following recent gains. After sustained upward movements, it is common for markets to experience short-term corrections as participants secure returns.

Gold ETFs vs physical gold: What smart investors are looking at, explains expertGold may be timeless, but the way Indians invest in it is changing fast. With rising awareness of hidden costs, gold ETFs are gaining traction as a smarter, hassle-free alternative.

How Piyush Pandey made India fall in love with adsPiyush Pandey transformed Indian advertising with heartfelt stories and local flavour. His campaigns blended wit and emotion, leaving a lasting cultural impact.

Remembering Piyush Pandey: The ad legend who made brands immortalFor over four decades, the Jaipur-born storyteller reshaped Indian advertising, turning simple commercials into cultural phenomena and making brands like Fevicol, Cadbury, and Asian Paints inseparable from the Indian consciousness.​

CA explains why saving before spending works best for financial stabilityWhile most people save whatever is left after spending, CA Meenal Goel flips the approach. Her mantra, prioritise savings before expenses, has helped her stay financially secure and stress-free.

Error in your ITR filing? Here's how to correct it with an updated returnRealised there's an error in your ITR after submission? You're not alone. Many taxpayers make small mistakes while filing, but the good news is — you can still correct them through an updated return.

Why the world's central banks are buying gold like never beforeNot just households and investors, but central banks around the globe are buying gold like it's Dhanteras every day. So why are the world's biggest buyers going for bullion? Read on to find out.
Target announces 1,800 job cuts in a decade amid falling salesAll corporate employees in the US have been asked to work from home next week as the company finalises its restructuring process.

Gold, silver prices continue to fall: Is the rally over and what should you do next?After a nine-week winning streak, gold and silver prices are finally losing steam as investors book profits amid a stronger dollar, easing global tensions, and anticipation over key US economic data.
Sensex, Nifty open flat as FMCG stocks offset metal gainsThe S&P BSE Sensex lost 96.63 points to 84,459.77, while the NSE Nifty50 was down by 24.20 points to 25,866.45 as of 9:28 am.

Midwest listing today: Will it give investors profit? See what GMP suggestsMidwest IPO was subscribed 92.36 times overall. The retail portion was booked 25.52 times, the Qualified Institutional Buyers (QIB) category saw 146.99 times, while the Non-Institutional Investors (NII) category was subscribed 176.57 times.

entertainment.headline: Nikitin Dheer shares emotional note after immersing father Pankaj Dheer's ashes Actor Nikitin Dheer posted a heartfelt message after losing his father, Pankaj Dheer, on October 15. He even immersed the late actor's ashes at Parmarth Niketan Ashram, Rishikesh.

BB19 Episode 63: Salman Khan's ex-wives remark stirs tension for Abhishek Bajaj Salman Khan's indirect comment referencing ex-wives caused tension for Abhishek Bajaj during 'Bigg Boss 19's Weekend Ka Vaar. The host highlighted the intense public scrutiny facing contestants and questioned the dynamics in the house.

Ek Deewane Ki Deewaniyat box office Day 5: Harshvardhan's film hit by Thamma wave 'Ek Deewane Ki Deewaniyat' earned Rs 34 crore in five days despite limited screens. The film outperformed expectations and remained steady alongside bigger releases like 'Thamma'.

Thamma box office Day 5: Ayushmann's film shows growth, eyes Rs 100 crore Ayushmann Khurrana's 'Thamma' achieved over Rs 78 crore at the box office after five days, showing sustained growth. The film is now eyeing Rs 100 crore.

Yeh Jo Hai Zindagi: How Satish Shah's comedy found its template in the '80s show Catering to middle-class homes, 'Yeh Jo Hai Zindagi' let Satish Shah balance a different ditzy character in each episode with the art of keeping it real

Bhuvan Bam announces Bollywood debut with Dharma Productions Bhuvan Bam officially announced his Bollywood debut with Dharma Productions. He shared his excitement and gratitude with a post on Instagram.

Alia Bhatt calls mother Soni Razdan her whole universe in sweet birthday post Actor Alia Bhatt shared a special post to wish her mother, veteran actor Soni Razdan, on her birthday. Take a look at the post here.

Suniel Shetty's dig at Virat, Rohit critics: Legends don't have to prove a point On Saturday, October 25, Suniel Shetty shared a post and praised Virat Kohli and Rohit Sharma for silencing their critics with stellar performances during the third One Day International (ODI) against Australia in Sydney.

What Satish Shah said about Sooraj Barjatya after meeting for Hum Aapke Hain Koun Satish Shah had interesting things to say about Sooraj Barjatya in an interview that has resurfaced after the actor's death. Shah worked with the filmmaker in two of the biggest films of his career: Hum Aapke Hain Koun and Hum Saath-Saath Hain
PM Modi mourns Satish Shah's death: True legend of Indian entertainment Prime Minister Narendra Modi mourned the death of veteran actor Satish Shah. He was 74.
KJo, Johny Lever, Farah Khan and celebs mourn Satish Shah's death Several stars, including Karan Johar, Johny Lever, Farah Khan and others, mourned the death of veteran actor Satish Shah.

Fan offers Vir Das tickets to Travis Scott gig at half price. Guess what he said Actor-comedian Vir Das gave a witty reply to a social media user who offered him tickets to a Travis Scott concert at half price.

Satish Shah dies: Remembering the veteran actor's life on and off-screen Veteran actor Satish Shah, celebrated for his iconic comic roles, died on October 25 at 74. Over a career spanning nearly five decades, he appeared in more than 250 films and TV shows.

Diljit Dosanjh on KBC 17: Singer reveals the Amitabh Bachchan film he disliked Singer-actor Diljit Dosanjh is set to feature as a guest on 'Kaun Banega Crorepati 17' and discuss his charity for Punjab flood relief.

Richa Chadha's witty post for Ali Fazal's birthday is all about real-world love Actor Richa Chadha shared a heartfelt post for Ali Fazal while showcasing a beautiful, unseen moment from his birthday celebrations. In her note, Chadha reminded fans that love shines brightest in the real world.

Sarabhai vs Sarabhai actor Satish Shah dies at 74 Popular actor Satish Shah, best known for his role in 'Sarabhai vs Sarabhai', died on October 25. The 74-year-old was suffering from kidney-related issues.

Ajith Kumar's chest tattoo steals the spotlight during family temple visit. Pics Actor Ajith Kumar's wife offered a rare peek into their personal life during a temple visit in Kerala with son Aadvik. In the pics, the actor flaunted his chest tattoo, believed to depict Goddess Ootukulangara Bhagavathy.

Sudha Kongara reunites with Anurag Kashyap, shares fond memory from 25 years ago Filmmaker Sudha Kongara recalled her 25-year friendship with Anurag Kashyap, expressing her desire for him to write a love story for her.

The Girlfriend trailer: Rashmika Mandanna battles love, control and pain The trailer of 'The Girlfriend' gives a gripping glimpse of Rashmika Mandanna as a woman trapped in a toxic relationship. Directed by Rahul Ravindran, the film explores emotional turmoil through a strong female lens.

general news.headline: Bus batteries sparked Andhra bus fire, smartphones made it deadlier: ProbeA preliminary investigation has suggested that the bus's batteries and a large consignment of smartphones on the vehicle aggravated the blaze when the vehicle hit a recklessly-driven bike and caught fire in Andhra Pradesh's Kurnool. The inferno claimed 20 lives.
Rs 50 lakh insurance, pension for panchayat members: Tejashwi Yadav's poll promiseRs 50 lakh insurance, pension for panchayat members: Tejashwi Yadav's poll promise

Trump does it again, says India is completely cutting back on Russian oilTrump once again claims India will halt Russian oil imports "completely", even as New Delhi insists its energy choices are guided by national interest, not Washington's wishes.

Month after Karur stampede, Vijay to meet victims' families privately tomorrowActor-politician Vijay will meet families of the Karur stampede victims at a private event near Chennai on Monday, a month after the tragedy that claimed 41 lives.

Techies by day, cabbies at night: Why Bengaluru engineers are driving Ola, UberEver had cab drivers in Bengaluru answer your call in fluent corporate lingo? Chances are, they might have been techies. It's not just for the money. Software engineers are driving cabs to beat loneliness at home and drudgery at the office, revealing a problem in our corporate culture.

I'm not done: Kamala Harris says she could still be America's first woman presidentA defiant Kamala Harris says she's "not done" and could "possibly" be president one day, teasing a White House return after her loss to Trump in the Presidential elections last year.
Video: Trump does his iconic dance as he arrives in Malaysia for Asean summitUS President Donald Trump surprised everyone by dancing on the red carpet after landing in Malaysia for the ASEAN summit.

Potholes, Bengaluru clean-up drive: Kiran Shaw, DK Shivakumar's 2nd meet after spatThe dinner meeting, hosted at Dr. Kiran Mazumdar-Shaw's residence was attended by TV Mohandas Pai, Tanveer Ahmed, and BBMP Commissioner Maheshwar Rao. According to sources, the discussions centred on pothole repairs, the development of the Outer Ring Road, citywide clean-up drives, debris removal, and expediting Metro work along the ORR.

The day Tipu Sultan sent rockets into the sky and inspired NASA engineersTipu Sultan's iron-cased rockets changed the course of warfare during the Anglo-Mysore wars. This innovation inspired global rocketry and highlighted India's early technological advances.

India ready for Bangladesh challenge to fine-tune semi-final preparationsAfter securing a semi-final spot, India aim to build momentum against Bangladesh in their last group game of the ICC Women's Cricket World Cup. Bangladesh look to end their campaign on a high despite earlier missed chances.

Cop accused of raping Maharashtra doctor who died by suicide arrestedPolice sub-inspector Gopal Badane and software engineer Prashant Bankar have been arrested in connection with the alleged suicide of a woman government doctor in Maharashtra's Satara district.

Cyclone Montha likely to hit Andhra on Oct 28; rain alert for Odisha, Tamil NaduCyclone Montha is expected to make landfall on the Andhra Pradesh coast near Kakinada, between Machilipatnam and Kalingapatnam, on Tuesday evening or night (October 28).

Soha Ali Khan on raising Inaaya, paparazzi culture, and social media boundariesSoha Ali Khan opens up about raising daughter Inaaya, handling fame, and setting social media boundaries on 'Anything But'.

5 children test HIV-positive after blood transfusion at Jharkhand hospitalThe matter first came to light when the family of a thalassemia-affected child alleged that HIV-infected blood was transfused to him at the Chaibasa Sadar Hospital blood bank.

Reddit backs techie questioning 11 pm client calls scheduled by managerIn a now-viral post on Reddit, a techie said he had recently been moved to a new project where his manager, based in the United States, had begun setting late-night sync calls.

Wife storms off mid-argument, Maharashtra man slits twin daughters' throatsOn October 21, Rahul Chavan had a fallout with his wife while travelling to Andhera village. His wife left the journey midway and went to her parents' house. Chavan reached the village, took his daughters to a forest and slit their throats.

Australia tour done, what's next for Virat Kohli and Rohit Sharma?Rohit Sharma and Virat Kohli starred in India's consolation win against Australia at the SCG. With the tour Down Under done, what's next for the two stalwarts?
Question Time: Weekly News QuizThink you read the headlines this week? Let's test that!

Trump hits Canada with additional 10% levy over 'fraudulent' anti-tariff adTrump announced a 10 per cent tariff hike on Canadian imports over Ontario's edited Reagan ad, which he called "fraudulent." The Reagan Foundation criticised the ad, and Canada remains open to trade talks.

Caught on camera: Biker's reckless ride moments before deadly Andhra bus blazeThe footage, recorded at a petrol pump around 2.23 am on October 24, shows the biker riding away unsteadily from near a fuel dispenser.

Internet obsessed with 'detective' in viral Louvre heist photo, but who's he really?A photo taken outside the Louvre during an ongoing heist investigation is going viral because a sharply dressed man who looked straight out of a detective film has become the centre of attention. The internet believes he's one of the investigators involved in the case, but is he really? Here's what we know:

Meet the Chennai professor with 150 degrees, and the promise behind his storyProfessor VN Parthiban from Chennai has collected more than 150 degrees over 30 years, spending most of his salary on study and aiming to cross 200. It all started with a promise.

Earth has a new quasi-moon: What does it really mean?First spotted in August 2025 by the Pan-STARRS observatory in Hawaii, the quasi-moon has likely been accompanying Earth for about 60 years, scientists say.

sports.headline: Harry Brook's ferocious 135 rescues England from embarrassment vs New Zealand England captain Harry Brook scored a career-best 135 to rescue his side after a top-order collapse against New Zealand in the first ODI. His innings helped England reach a defendable total of 223 in 35.2 overs from being 56/6.

Sophie Devine urges better planning in World Cups after rain-hit Sri Lanka matches New Zealand skipper Sophie Devine has urged the ICC to plan future Women's World Cups more thoughtfully after multiple rain-hit matches in Sri Lanka derailed her team's semi-final hopes in what was her final ODI campaign.

Australia tour done, what's next for Virat Kohli and Rohit Sharma? Rohit Sharma and Virat Kohli starred in India's consolation win against Australia at the SCG. With the tour Down Under done, what's next for the two stalwarts?

Alyssa Healy in doubt for semi-final against India, hints Australia coach Australia captain Alyssa Healy is in doubt for the semi-final match against India, hinted head coach Shelley Nitschke. Healy suffered a calf strain after Australia's match against Bangladesh.

Inspired by Harmanpreet Kaur, Sobhana Mostary vows to make Bangladesh world beaters Women's World Cup Exclusive: Bangladesh's campaign in the tournament has been a story of near misses, but Sobhana Mostary has stood out as one of their most reliable batters. A product of the BKSP – the same institution that produced stars like Shakib Al Hasan and Litton Das - the Rangpur-born cricketer now aims to make the Tigresses a force to reckon with on the world stage.

India ready for Bangladesh challenge to fine-tune semi-final preparations After securing a semi-final spot, India aim to build momentum against Bangladesh in their last group game of the ICC Women's Cricket World Cup. Bangladesh look to end their campaign on a high despite earlier missed chances.

Australia awaken the beast within, fire chilling warning to India Women's World Cup: Australia demolished South Africa by seven wickets in Indore and set up a semi-final clash with Harmanpreet Kaur's India at Navi Mumbai. On Thursday, Alana King rocked the Proteas with the best-ever figures in the history of the tournament.

Virat Kohli turns back the clock at packed SCG: Legend, chasemaster, fighter For likely one final time in Australia, Virat Kohli reminded the Sydney Cricket Ground—and the cricketing world—why he is one of the greatest ODI batters of all time. Kohli finished unbeaten on 74 to guide India to victory in front of a raucous, predominantly Indian crowd.

Manchester United thump Brighton 4-2 for third straight win, climb into top four Manchester United claimed a third successive Premier League win as Matheus Cunha opened his account for the club and Bryan Mbeumo scored twice to secure a 4-2 victory over Brighton & Hove Albion.

Sophie Devine's farewell ODI: Emotions will be flying around, says New Zealand coachWomen's World Cup, ENG vs NZ: New Zealand coach Ben Sawyer said that there will be a lot of emotions when Sophie Devine steps out to play her farewell ODI on Sunday against England in Visakhapatnam.

England want to regain winning momentum before semis: Tammy BeaumontWomen's World Cup, ENG vs NZ: Tammy Beaumont said that England want to gain back their winning momentum against New Zealand on Sunday before they face South Africa in the semi-final.

Shreyas Iyer faces minimum three-week injury layoff: ReportIndia's ODI vice-captain Shreyas Iyer sustained a left rib cage injury while taking a catch in the Sydney ODI. His participation in the upcoming South Africa series remains uncertain, with a minimum recovery period of three weeks expected

Shubman Gill explains what makes Harshit Rana valuable for IndiaIndia captain Shubman Gill said that if Harshit Rana can consistently contribute 20 to 25 runs with the bat, he could well become the bowling all-rounder India have been seeking at No. 8. The Delhi pacer strengthened his case with a career-best four-wicket haul in the third ODI against Australia on Saturday.

In gloomy Navi Mumbai, Harleen Deol pushes her limits ahead of Bangladesh clashWomen's World Cup, IND vs BAN: Harleen Deol focused on improving her game against spin ahead of India's last group stage fixture against Bangladesh on Sunday in Navi Mumbai. The women in blue look to carry momentum into the semi-finals, where they will face Australia.

National Shame: Australian Cricketers Molested in MP During World Cup, Accused ArrestedThis special report covers the shocking molestation of two Australian women cricketers in Indore, Madhya Pradesh, during the ICC Women's Cricket World Cup. The state's minister, Kailash Vijayvargiya, condemned the incident and promised strict action against the accused, who has been arrested. The minister called it a 'shameful' act, further stating, 'this concerns the honour of our country'. The incident occurred when the players were walking from their hotel to a café. The accused, identified as Aqeel Khan, allegedly has a prior criminal record. Following the incident, which has sparked a political controversy over women's safety, the Madhya Pradesh Cricket Association has issued an apology, and security protocols for the visiting teams are being reviewed.

La Liga: Barcelona suffer big blow as Raphinha gets ruled out for El ClasicoBarcelona prepare for a crucial El Clasico against Real Madrid without key players, as assistant Marcus Sorg steps in for suspended manager Hansi Flick.

Marufa Akter, Rabeya Khan good enough to play in WPL: Sobhana MostaryWomen's World Cup, IND vs BAN: In the pre-match press conference, Sobhana Mostary said that Marufa Akter and Rabeya Khan are good enough to represent teams in the Women's Premier League.

The women in blue look to carry momentum into the semi-finals, where they will face Australia.

Virat-Rohit have been winning games for India for 15 years: Shubman GillIndia captain Shubman Gill lauded Rohit Sharma and Virat Kohli for their brilliant batting, calling their performance "a treat to watch" and emphasising how their experience helped guide the team.

Can Bangladesh beat India? Sobhana Mostary confident before Navi Mumbai clashBangladesh's Sobhana Mostary said the team will rely on their experience against India to finish the Women's World Cup on a positive note, despite being already out of semi-final contention. She also praised captain Nigar Sultana Joty for her calm leadership.

Gavaskar backs Rohit Sharma, Virat Kohli for 2027 World Cup after Sydney heroicsSunil Gavaskar says Rohit Sharma and Virat Kohli have made a strong case for India's 2027 World Cup squad. Their experience and recent form will be a big asset for India in the ICC showpiece event.

Deepti Sharma a champion player, she steps up everytime India need her: Avishkar SalviWomen's World Cup, IND vs BAN: In the press conference before the Bangladesh clash, India bowling coach Avishkar Salvi heaped praise on Deepti Sharma, who's currently the second-highest wicket-taker of the tournament and has also played handy knocks with the bat.

Rohit, Virat showed class is permanent and form is temporary: GavaskarBatting great Sunil Gavaskar praised Virat Kohli and Rohit Sharma for their stellar batting in the Sydney ODI, saying the duo demonstrated that class is permanent, while form is temporary. Rohit Sharma (121 not out) notched up his 33rd ODI century, while Virat Kohli (74 not out) provided steady support as India chased down Australia's modest 236 with nearly 11 overs to spare.

Australian farewell done right: Ro-Ko's Sydney send-off was pure paisa vasoolAustralia vs India, 3rd ODI: In Sydney, Ro-Ko gave fans everything they came for — runs, energy, and joy. The crowd roared, the legends delivered, and the two greats left Australian soil with a farewell they truly deserved.

Richa Ghosh to play against Bangladesh? India bowling coach shares an updateWomen's World Cup, IND vs BAN: Bowling coach Avishkar Salvi provided an update on the injured Richa Ghosh ahead of the clash against Bangladesh and also spoke about India's bowling performances in the tournament.

Ranji Trophy 2025: Sarfaraz Khan fails to impress amidst India A selection rowSarfaraz Khan failed to make an impact on the opening day of Mumbai's Ranji Trophy match after being left out of the India A squad. Ajinkya Rahane's brilliant century helped Mumbai build a strong position, raising questions about Sarfaraz's form and fitness.

education.headline: The role of data analytics in modern advertising educationThis transformation also exercises a significant impact on the realm of 'advertising education.'

NCERT deletes Azad Pak, adds China's aggression reference in Class 12 textbookThe NCERT has made final changes to its Class 12 Political Science textbook syllabus for the upcoming academic year, including a revision in reference to India's border situation with China, Azad Pakistan, Article 370 and more.

NEET row: Bihar cops find 6 post-dated cheques 'issued for question paper brokers'Six post-dated cheques which were suspected to have been issued in favour of mafia demanding over Rs 30 lakh from each candidate seeking alleged leaked question paper ahead of NEET held last month were recovered by Bihar Police.

Forest fires surge tenfold from 2004 to 2017: Causes, impact and preventionAmidst a relentless surge, intense forest fires are now multiplying tenfold, casting a menacing shadow over our flora and fauna. Year by year, their fiery grip tightens, threatening ecosystems far and wide, now extending their reach to impact human lives.

Fresh plea in Supreme Court to recall NEET results, reconduct examsA fresh petition has been filed in the Supreme Court to recall the National Entrance cum Eligibility Test - Under Graduate (NEET-UG) 2024 results and re-conduct fresh examination after discrepancies in the declared results.

NTA issues clarification after NEET result controversy over toppers, high cut-offIn a detailed statement, the National Testing Agency (NTA) said that the increase in cut-off and number of toppers in the NEET-UG reflect the competitive nature of the exam and maintained that the test's integrity has not been compromised.

Exclusive: Arvind Kejriwal claims 'BJP succession war, PM backing Amit Shah'Speaking exclusively to India Today TV, Delhi Chief Minister Arvind Kejriwal claimed that there is a "succession war" within the BJP. He also claimed that the ruling party is "not fighting the Lok Sabha elections as a team".

4 medical students arrested in Bihar for appearing as proxies for NEET aspirantsFour MBBS students who appeared in place of NEET aspirants in the medical entrance exam were detained in Bihar's Purnea.

NEET-UG question paper not leaked, claims baseless: National Testing AgencyThe reports claiming question paper leak in the medical entrance exam NEET-UG are "completely baseless and without any ground", the National Testing Agency (NTA) has clarified.
The generation with answers: Tech-savvy Indian youth tackling global challengesIndia's tech-savvy youth rewriting the global narrative, one solution at a time.

Left sweeps JNU students' polls, Dhananjay is first Dalit presidentThe Left swept the Jawaharlal Nehru University Students' Union (JNUSU) polls, winning all four posts and trouncing the RSS-affiliated ABVP. The ABVP was leading at one point, but the Left eventually surged ahead and emerged victorious.
The power of knowledge: Education's influence on real estate market trendsIn a dynamic sector like real estate, investing in continuing education is not simply an option; it is a requirement.

JNU students' body election on March 22 after 4 yearsThe Jawaharlal Nehru University Students' Union (JNUSU) polls will take place on March 22, more than four years after the last elections were held in September 2019.

UP 12th board exam math, biology papers leaked on WhatsApp, complaint filedThe mathematics and biology question papers for the Uttar Pradesh class 12 board exam were allegedly leaked on a WhatsApp group.

UP Police Constable recruitment exam cancelled days after paper leakThe Uttar Pradesh Police Constable recruitment exam held on February 17 and 18 was canceled due to a paper leak. The Chief Minister has announced a re-examination within the next six months.
